<@U7SL518D6> I just created my first test custom object, and was wondering what is the param "restorable" for. Also same question for the "hidden" property param? Thanks!

Luke Summerfield is giving a talk on “Using your website to grow your business”
<https://join.inbound.com/session/HubSpot-academy/-MFCHrHtVhppXkPJ5yFK>
While lending itself more on the marketing side, may be interesting to many of you. May also help you sell new websites to clients.

If you miss it, remember you can check the On-Demand section to watch it later.
Fabulous question Louis, I don’t personally know the answer to that right now but will look into it.
`restorable` means it goes to a recycle bin after a delete action. This has to be `true`. Still checking on `hidden`.

`hidden` is in the property definitions. It shares the same meaning as the stand-alone property API which is
> If true, the property won’t be visible and can’t be used in HubSpot.
So effectively you almost always want that to be `false`.
All the credit really goes to <@UFBNA9K9A> :slightly_smiling_face: he’s awesome.
